Authors: Sukarman H., Kan A.C., Fandi R.
Title: The analysis of value shop as a basic design of mobile applications in cirebon and surrounding areas
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 14480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukarman, H., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 14480, Indonesia; Kan, A.C., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 14480, Indonesia; Fandi, R., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 14480, Indonesia
Abstract: The improvement of prosperity in city can be achieved, among others, by increasing tourism activities. The city and regency of Cirebon were selected in this study to see the potential and the obstacles that occur to make these areas as tourist destination. Kertajati international airport is available, dozens of tourist destinations both for enjoying culinary, historical, religious sites, supporting adequate intercity and local transportation, and so on. The main problem for Cirebon for tourists who will or are visiting the city is the specific and clear information about the destination. The opportunity and obstacles to find the best solution are evaluated through the Value Shop system. The need for a mobile application framework that is well developed and backed with comprehensive data is proposed. The design of the application framework uses the OOAD process. It is hoped that this application framework will make it easy for prospective travelers to feel comfortable toward what they can get from the city and regency of Cirebon. In addition, the Population and the government of Cirebon city and regency will be able to boost their wealth. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Mobile application; The city and regency of cirebon; Tourism; Value shop
Index Keywords: Information management; Application frameworks; International airport; Mobile applications; Tourism activities; Tourist destinations; Mobile computing

Authors: Sukarman H., Rizkiyana F.Y., Apriyanto, Al Farizi M.F.
Title: The design of information system and technology strategy for improving performance of healthcare service with EA3 framework: (Case study: Summit)
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukarman, H., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rizkiyana, F.Y., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Apriyanto, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Al Farizi, M.F., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Health is an important factor in keeping the community productive, creative, and delighted. However, it is still difficult to obtain adequate healthcare services in Indonesia. Many of Indonesian have chosen to seek treatment in neighboring countries such as Singapore, Malaysia, and Australia. As a result, a lot of foreign exchange flows into those countries. Such problems exist in health support efforts. The scarcity of human resources, especially in the field of highly capable nursing, is a field that will be cultivated by the Summit. The other problems in the field of nursing training make it necessary for the Summit to be clever in integrating strategies, the business processes with the use of information system and technology. The variety of competition and tight government regulations forced the Summit to continue to exist and to be able to compete in the future using information systems and technology. For this reason, Summit uses the EA3 Enterprise Architecture Framework approach so that challenges can be overcome while taking advantage of opportunities and gaining competitive advantage. It is hoped that with this design of the information system and technology strategy, investment in the field can be directed and the business objectives that have been set can be achieved. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Enterprise architecture; Information system and technology; Nursing education services; Strategy design
Index Keywords: Competition; Information management; Information systems; Laws and legislation; Nursing; Business objectives; Competitive advantage; Enterprise Architecture; Government regulation; Healthcare services; Improving performance; Information systems and technologies; Technology strategies; Information use

Authors: Sukarman H., Putri N.K.S., Qing C.H.G.
Title: Green information technology government regulation components: Improving Indonesia green information technology
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukarman, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putri, N.K.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Qing, C.H.G., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information and communication technology (ICT) becomes one of the key drivers of economic growth and competitiveness. In contrary, the increasing of the ICT usage is not followed by the increasing of the green ICT awareness and behavior. Our previous research on Private higher education institution practice of green information technology governance model had resulted some obstruction on the implementation. One of the most crucial aspect among others is the government policies and regulations deficiencies. Hence, this study describes as well as proposes green IT government regulation components which can be regulated by Indonesia’s government. 6(six) green IT government regulation components (green knowledge, regulatory design, regulation dimensions, directive cost, awareness and innovation/technology) were categorized based on literature review. © 2005 – ongoing JATIT & LLS
Author Keywords: Government Regulation); Green Computing; Green Information Technology; Green Information Technology Government

Title: Green Information Technology Policy in Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukarman, H., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putri, N.K.S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Based on prior research about green information technology governance model for private higher education institution, it was founded that the difficulties of green IT implementation, caused by lack of government policies and regulations. Although the Green IT Strategy model has been proposed and elaborated in terms of its starting point and the detail of activities, many of them are reluctant to implement it. Hence, this paper describes and proposes green IT policy that can be prepared and regulated by Indonesia's government. Basic model and advance model of green IT government model were recommended. Various laws and regulations on green IT topic were collected and categorized. Expectantly, it will inspires both government and institutions to implement the strategy. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: green computing; green information technology; green information technology policy; Indonesia policy
Index Keywords: Engineering education; Information management; Public policy; Higher education institutions; Indonesia; Information technology governance; Laws and regulations; Green computing
